fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to accept user input strings/fields or choose a related git reference when kicking off a custom build.

The user input could be made available as environmental variables. The names of the fields could be defined in the yml file, eg.

{code}
#!yml

pipelines:
  custom:
    stuffwithuserinput:
      - userinput:
      	- foo
      	- bar
      - step:
          script:
            - echo $foo $bar
{code}

So far my use cases have all been doing things with two repos; so I could also use env vars that identify a repo, branch or tag based on user input (eg. dropdowns). That would have the nice side effect of checking the target exists.

I can already implicitly identify one side of that process by choosing where to trigger the build; but obviously not both. There are some ways to do build gymnastics and get around it, but it would be a heck of a lot easier to just be able to spec "this build needs that tag from that repo" when you run the custom build.
fields.summary: Take user input for Pipelines custom build

fields.description:
{{pullrequest:created}} webhooks only contain abbreviated SHA1s in the {{source.commit.hash}}, {{destination.commit.hash}} and {{merge_commit.hash}} properties.

As a result we need to make an additional API call to fetch the actual SHA1 when handling {{pullrequest:created}} webhooks.

It would be great if the hook contained the commit SHA1, we could avoid the additional API calls.
fields.summary: Use the full SHA1 in webhooks

fields.description: With Two Step verifications setup you receive a error when you try and login with BitBucket Extension in Visual Studio. Please see the attached file
fields.summary: BitBucket Extention SSH Two Step Verification Login

fields.description:
Really need to be able to search for literal strings in code; perhaps by quoting the search string.

E.g. "docs/mydoc.jsp" should return just exact matches instead of everywhere a document has the substrings "docs", "mydoc" and "jsp".
fields.summary: Need ability to search for literal strings

fields.description:
Once you access the commits page of any repo and make a comment in any file a comment symbol will appear by side the file commented (on "Files changed"). If you click on comment's balloon it does not scroll the page to the comment, just throw you to the file (same as clicking on file's name).

h1. How to Reproduce
* Access any repo.
* Click on "Commits".
* Go to any commit.
* Create a comment in a file. (preferentially in the bottom of the page)
* On "Files changed" click on the comment's balloon by side the file you've commented.\\
You should be guided to the file, not to the comment.
fields.summary: Comment symbol does not throw the page to the comment

fields.description:
![Screen Shot 2017-07-13 at 11.03.38 AMaa.png]\\
!490138960-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-13%20at%2011.03.38%20AM.png|thumbnail!\\
[https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B98uO_h8iXgkb1NXdXlva0M2VGM](Link URL)
fields.summary: New Navigation Rehydration Bug

fields.description:
Currently, for repo A that clones repo B in Bitbucket as a dependency, an admin must

* A pipeline SSH key pair must be generated
* The public key generated must be added as an read-only access key to the dependent repo

This must be repeated for each repo and dependent repo.

----
Feedback received on the [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Use+SSH+keys+in+Bitbucket+Pipelines|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Use%2BSSH%2Bkeys%2Bin%2BBitbucket%2BPipelines] page:

"Can you simplify this for us and just add a dropdown list with all the other Bitbucket repositories (accessed by the repo admin) and manage SSH access to them for Bitbucket Pipelines seamlessly? I just want to choose on a repo A that it's pipelines should have access to a repo B and not spend hours troubleshooting SSH keys. I bet you think it's easy and you know how to do it, but for me it's unnecessary blocker and it just doesn't work."
fields.summary: Manage read access for dependent repos without managing SSH keys

fields.description:
Everything was working fine about 4 hours ago, but suddenly I can't push or pull for any of my repositories, getting the error "remote: repository does not exist."  I normally name them with CamelCase both on BitBucket and locally in my hgrc file.  I finally figured out that if I changed the name in my hgrc file to be all lower-case for the repo name, I could push and pull like normal.

So, as far as I can tell something changed in the last few hours that made BitBucket not recognize any Mercurial repositories that aren't in all lower-case.
fields.summary: Suddenly (within the last few hours) can't connect to hg repos unless name is set to all lower-case

fields.description:
When adding used SSH keys to your Bitbucket account, The error displays "Someone has already registered this as a deploy key." however isn't informative on where is the SSH key being used at.

!3234058516-Pasted_Image_13_07_2017__9_36_AM.png|thumbnail!

Users then have to run git commands to identify where was the SSH key used.

{code}
#!python

ssh git@bitbucket.org
PTY allocation request failed on channel 0
authenticated via a deploy key.


You can use git or hg to connect to Bitbucket. Shell access is disabled.

This deploy key has read access to the following repositories:

username/repo_slug: repo_slug access key label -- name
Connection to bitbucket.org closed.
{code}

It'd be great if we can display the where is the SSH key is being used on the page so that users don't have to troubleshoot much.
fields.summary: Display used SSH key location when adding SSH keys

fields.description:
Please add the feature so we can add the encoding we need, as we currently have the issue with some characters that are not being displayed correctly due the UTF-8 Encoding,

This is an import matter as we strongly believe that this issue will encourage people and projects to move to other Git control software in order to solve the encoding issue
fields.summary: Accent Issue with UTF-8 Encoding

fields.description:
Create  a new Repo\\
In the BB Cloud UI select Overview\\
Select " I have an existing project "\\
If you have SSH as your default protocol , you will see that the path is shows incorrectly, instead of @bitbucket.org: accountName\\
we are displaying @bitbucket.org/accountName\\
this needs to be updated per our support document:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/change-the-remote-url-to-your-repository-794212774.html

For HTTPS protocol the path is set correctly.
fields.summary: Get started with command line shows incorrect URL for SSH remote

fields.description:
The source browser displays the last date of the most recent commit in the entire branch, rather than the current file's last modification date. See screenshot examples.

This does not seem like the proper information to display there. Instead the date displayed should be the last date the current file was actually modified. My reasoning for suggests this is as follows:

# The timestamp shown when viewing the source of the file is the last time the referred file was pushed.

That means every file in the repository shows the same timestamp when using the source file viewer in bitbucket. In any regularly maintained repository, a single file changing and being committed and subsequently pushed would mean all files now show _some_other file's last change / commit date. Not the current file. That's seems confusing.

# The user interface is confusing. The source viewer displays the date in the context of the current file. But in reality that date has nothing to do with the current file, instead its related to ANY other file that was committed and then pushed to the branch.
# There isn't a way to even find the last modified date of the current file in the source viewer unless you click the commit selector dropdown - which DOES show the current file change commit history.

3b) Think about that for one moment - The element which you click to get access to the current file's commit history has the information that shows the most recent commit for the whole branch. Those two pieces of information are highly inconsistent with each other.

To resolve this issue the current modified date for the file should be displayed in the file browser. The current commit date of the branch should be shown somewhere else in the interface if that information is deemed still important.
fields.summary: Source Browser File Timestamp Should Display Last File Modified Date

fields.description:
Customers experience Pipelines build getting stuck at 1 hour 59 min execution time and are marked as Failed, even though the process has already successfully completed .

We are currently working on this issue as a matter of priority
fields.summary: Pipelines build  doesn't quit and is getting stuck at 1 h 59min as failed even though the process completed (BBCI-4848)

fields.description:
On the billing/plan details screen, the grey text below the usage of minutes incorrectly shows additional minutes that are not available to annual plan customers. Annual plans only include up to 50 build minutes per month, and 1GB of storage.

Please update/clarify the pipelines minutes message for customers on annual plan to specify that they need to change the plan before they can get more build minutes
fields.summary: Billing details page shows incorrect available usage minutes for annual customers

fields.description:
We really need the PR merge check require all reviewers like the Server version has ("Require all reviewers to approve for pull requests")

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/checks-for-merging-pull-requests-776640039.html?_ga=2.153471679.604206873.1499705979-1169125749.1491412544
fields.summary: Require approval from all reviewers

fields.description:
I [enabled dependency caching|https://blog.bitbucket.org/2017/06/27/faster-builds-dependency-caching/] for my ASP.NET Core project and found that time to save+restore cache is more that time to re-download dependencies from internet.

First, my {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}}:

{code}
image: microsoft/dotnet
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        caches:
          - nuget
        script:
          - chmod 755 build.sh
          - ./build.sh
definitions:
  caches:
    nuget: ~/.nuget/packages
{code}

All real build job is done inside build.sh, which contains {{dotnet restore}} (restore dependencies) and {{dotnet test}} (to build and run tests) and some other light (not time-consuming) tasks.

Screenshot of build with empty cache:

!3078662556-empty-cache.png|thumbnail!

"Netto" build time (right) is 26 seconds (2+1+23). "Brutto" build time (left) is 2m08s. I was watching build progress/logs and seen that my {{build.sh}} is over, and pipeline was "Uploading cache". It took 1.5 min to save my cache folder, which was downloaded in less than 23 sec (in {{build.sh}} step).

After that, my cache size (reported on Pipelines homepage) is 197 MB.

Now I made minor change and pushed new commit, which was built with cached stuff:

!1352417064-with-cache.png|thumbnail!

Now we see:

* "Brutto" build time is 37sec - "better" that previous one, but worse that "without-cache" (26 sec)
* "Build setup" stage took 17sec - to checkout changes (only one text file changed! - let's assume same 2sec as first build) and cache folder download/extract: 17-2 = 15 sec.
* "build.sh" took 14sec (compared to 23) - better, win is 9 sec.

Lets' summarize:

* I win 9sec on each build because of cached dependencies
* I lose 15sec on each build to "restore" cache
* I lose 1.5 min every 7 days (cache expiration)

So, there is no "win" in using cache due to long save/restore operations.
fields.summary: Pipelines cache: copy/restore cache is longer than re-download dependencies

fields.description:
i create one repository in my bitbucket. i am trying to integrate aws codedeploy with my bitbucket, for this i create policy and role. and after i paste role ARN and select the region in bitbucket, it will show the following error.

When any changes is done to a team repo settings, notification emails are sent out to other admins.

In the footer of the email, the following line is found:\\
"Team email forwarding can be configured from the groups administration page"

The link leads to the groups config of the team. No configuration in regard to notification can be found there
fields.summary: Team email forwarding can't be disabled despite footer in notification email

fields.description: Currently, we're using the pipelines system as a task runner to run deployments. However, particularly in the case of test systems, it'd be useful to supply variables to the build -- deploy version ${x} with the ansible configuration at HEAD, for example.
fields.summary: Supply variables in the build

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A username that has an underscore or dash as either first, second or third character, doesn't show up as suggested reviewer in a PR

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with username T-123
# Give them access to a repo of yours
# Create a PR in this repo
# In the 'Reviewers' field of the PR, type 'T-'

h3. Expected Results
The user T-123 should show up as suggested user

h3. Actual Results
User 'T-123' is not suggested

h3. Workaround
If the underscore or dash is the 1st character, copy-pasting the username in the Reviewer field will work.
fields.summary: A username that has an underscore or dash as either first, second or third character, doesn't show up as suggested reviewer in a PR

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A team member has the ability to view the whole list of the team's Projects, even if he/she have access only to a single project.

This is problematic for companies that have many different clients, and they don't want team member X, who has access to repos of project-X,  to see that the company is working on some other project Y.

h3. Suggested Solution
In the page:

* https://bitbucket.org/team-username/profile/projects

hide private projects if the team member doesn't have access to its repos.
fields.summary: As a team admin I want my team members to see only the private project(s) with repos they have access to

fields.description:
The current merge strategy for Mercurial repositories only allows merge commits. It'd be great if we can allow squash merge for Mercurial repositories as well.

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/work-with-pull-requests-223220593.html
fields.summary: Allow squash merge for Mercurial repo

fields.description:
I am proposing to add a new environment variable {{BITBUCKET_PR}} to pipeline builds triggered by a pull request.

When set, the build was triggered by a pull request and it contains the id of the PR.\\
When not set, the build was not triggered by a pull request.

Use case: Additional feedback can be added to a PR via a comment without the need to enforce a build status or go through a complicated third party upload.
fields.summary: Environment variable for Pull Request ID

fields.description:
Settings, environment variables, SSH keys and integrations for Pipelines under the repo is not transferred when you "[Change or transfer repository ownership|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/change-or-transfer-repository-ownership-289964397.html]".

When the transfer is made, you will have to reenable Pipelines and configure its settings.
fields.summary: Pipelines settings and configurations not transferred when transferring repository ownership

fields.description:
We would like to run a custom pipeline before merging the PR into master.

It would be a nice addition to be able to run the custom pipeline from the same page instead of going to the last commit of the PR.

Currently you can only access it as explained here\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/run-pipelines-manually-861242583.html

Thank you!
fields.summary: Add "Run custom pipeline" to PR page

fields.description:
I configured Pipelines to run for bookmarks on Mercurial repositories.

I can select a bookmark on the Pipelines page but any list for the bookmark is always empty while they are listed in 'All branches'.
fields.summary: List of Pipelines run for a Mercurial bookmarks is empty.

fields.description:
The profile of the users that belong to a group under a team account, with just repositories access, do not display the team under the "Teams" tab.\\
eg. attached screenshots.
fields.summary: User not able to access the overview page of the team.

fields.description:
Colored text output in Bitbucket Pipelines command output helps with troubleshooting of builds. However, because we run builds with a non-interactive shell and the TERM variable is not set, many tools do not produce the ANSI color codes needed for these to work.

*Workaround*

Use command line arguments like {{--color}} or {{--color=force}} will work for many tools to force colored output in Pipelines. You may also need to set the {{TERM}} environment variable to 'xterm' for some tools.
fields.summary: Set TERM variable to ensure tools output colored text in Pipelines

fields.description:
hello,

I have a private repository which I share with other users, and since some time ago, the email notifications has stopped working. Ie. after I commit changes none of us get emails notifying about these... I checked all the notification settings and everything looks ok to me... is there anything I might be missing... btw since we stopped receiving emails notifications nothing has changed in our side...

Many thanks!\\
Marcelo
fields.summary: email notifications

fields.description:
Once you create a README on repo's overview and fill it with too long text, it will lose the text formatting. By clicking on Edit you can check that the syntax still correct.

!3450317209-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-05%20at%201.53.10%20PM.png|thumbnail!

This behavior can be checked here: https://bitbucket.org/cassiano--alves/testingreadme
fields.summary: Long READMEs are not properly rendered as Markdown

fields.description:
Hi - we are 10-15 developers all working on the same repos with lots of pull requests to master.

Our current setup is Bitbucket with Jenkins to run our pipeline to guarantee that everything builds and unit tests are passing before any pull request to master can be approved. We also only allow fast-forward merges.

So this means that everytime someone merges to the master every other pull request is invalid and have to rebase/merge from master before they can try again.Since the pipeline takes anything from 15 minutes to 35 minutes before a pull request can be approved it means that sometimes the same pull request has to go through a lot of iterations before it can finally be merged. The classic "rush to master" issue...

It would be nice if there was a way to reserve a timeslot where only YOU can merge,  so that you can be guaranteed to get your changes in, without going around the office to make sure no one else merges ahead of you.

Or do you have another solution or idea for this problem?
fields.summary: Add timeslot reservation for pull requests
Codesearch does not return, throws javascript error

Hi

Since two days i am trying to create a pull request to merge two branches but the page does not show me any  conflicts and the differences and displays a message "We are unable to load this page ".Hence ,not able to display the conflicts and Merge the branches .

The snapshot of the error is as follows:\\
!3438007070-pr%20issue.JPG|thumbnail!

Kindly look into the issue asap and let us know in case of any further requirement

fields.description:
It appears the cache is not used all the time, even though a cache exists.\\
For us it's used most of the time but every once in a while, we get a build where it doesn't download the cache in build setup.

We're currently using the node cache.
fields.summary: Dependecies caching not always used

fields.description:
_([Already reported Issue|BCLOUD-12232] re-created as someone marked it as 'invalid' in the beginning of 2016 and I have a suspicion that it might be ignored for that reason by the staff)_

h1. Steps to repeat
Unfortunately I have not found a way to repeat this, but I could provide one such private repository name in your system: vaimo/module-cms

Testing creating, deleting, re-creating with random new repository name (for example: test123), seems to work just fine, which makes me wonder if there's some kind of cache/index that BitBucket uses that just takes time to sync up with the reality?

Trying to clone the before-mentioned problem-child does result in expected behaviour:

{code}
#!shell
hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/vaimo/module-cms
remote: repository does not exist.
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!
{code}

But this is what one gets when trying to create it:

!464532625-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-05%20at%2011.59.01.png|thumbnail!

h1. Additional facts
# Before the deletion, the repository had a "remote: abort: abandoned transaction found!" BitBucket response, which I decided to quickly resolve (seeing that it's usually fixed manually by the staff) by re-creating the whole repository (which used to work just fine).
# Deletion did not result in any visible errors (although the user was not redirected to general Team's repository list as they usually are when removing a repository)
# The name still shows up in the search as well (indexing lag?)
fields.summary: Deleted repository can not be re-created.

fields.description:
https://bitbucket-pipelines.atlassian.io/validator throws an irrelevant error about services if you use custom cache settings (but are not using services at all).

To reproduce, take the documentation's example (from https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/caching-dependencies-895552876.html):

{code}
#!yml

image: ruby:2.4.0
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        caches:
          - bundler
        script:
          - bundle install

definitions:
  caches:
    bundler: vendor/bundle
{code}

...and run it through the validator. It errors saying "services" is required.

If you go ahead and use cache without services, it works fine.
fields.summary: Pipelines yml validator throws irrelevant error when adding cache settings

fields.description:
The duration between the build and the sum of duration of all commands do not add up. This is because the build setup includes the time to clone the repo and download caches but excludes the time to pull docker images and start containers. The time required to pull images also varies depending if images need to be downloaded or partially downloaded.

It would be nice to see a breakdown of the entire pipeline duration and not just each command.
fields.summary: Provide pipeline duration breakdown that includes time to pull images

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Go to my repo
* Click "Issues" in the left nav
* Click "Create an issue" in the "Bitbucket" section
* It spins forever and I see an error in the console; using Chrome, Version 59.0.3071.115 (Official Build) (64-bit)

See screenshot

fields.description:
!1875396749-bitbucket.PNG|thumbnail!

This is a prime example of the issue.

build: 2 mins 25 seconds

* build setup : 1 minute 12s
* tox: 9s
* push: 17s

total 1:38\\
Missing time : 47 seconds.

Example : When trying to add users to a Team Account, there is a notification that the account has hit its user limit which is referring to the Individual Account.

This bug shouldn't prevent adding users.

fields.description:
Customer originally signed up to receive updates on the issue from the Master site for Bitbucket Cloud.\\
Later he was no longer interested in receiving emails on that issue and wanted to un-subscribe\\
but when clicking the unsubscribe , he is getting a 500 error, here is the link that is used to unsubscribe\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/al45tair/netifaces/issue/51/unsubscribe/CTGreybeard/0516f92f3fa8021049d041769f6cdd094e72b97a/

As a workaround, to stop receiving email updates, they can just un-watch the issue, so this will help them not to receive any email updates on that issue that doesn't interest them anymore.
fields.summary: receiving 500 error when un-subscribing from issue emails

fields.summary: Downloads repo directly using API

fields.description: It would be nice to somehow link issues to branches to see if an issue is persist in different branches or not
fields.summary: Link issues to branches

fields.description:
Hi,

When I try to push to my repo I see:

pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/zbraniecki/mozilla-unified\\
searching for changes\\
remote: abort: abandoned transaction found!\\
remote: (run 'hg recover' to clean up transaction)\\
abort: stream ended unexpectedly (got 0 bytes, expected 4)

Seems like someone has to manually {{hg recover}} on the machine?
fields.summary: abort: abandoned transaction found!

fields.description:
please get someone to fix the "Paragraph" section of this page to teach your users the two-space requirement: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/markdown-syntax-guide-776639995.html

The above part is a bug (either in the documentation or in the implemenation, you choose - see Issue BCLOUD-7396 for reference), the below part is more of an enhancement request:

PS - it's also worth noting that bitbucket is kind enough to import a texty version of the changelogs into a Pull Request, which includes 4 spaces at the beginning of lines that fall under each commit. If there was any way bitbucket could automatically interpret these 4 spaces (which are always after a CR) as an instruction to display a CR on the pull request page, instead of removing the CR that is mid-paragraph, that would make it look awesome and be fully automatic.
fields.summary: Markdown syntax guide doesn't match markdown syntax

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Edit the .yml in a repo with the following, commit it and push:

{code}
#!python

pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
      - step:
          image: redis
          script:
            - redis-cli -h localhost ping
          services:
            - redis
            - database
definitions:
  services:
    redis:
      image: redis
    database:
      image: mysql
      environment:
        MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: password
        MYSQL_RANDOM_ROOT_PASSWORD: yes
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The build succeeds.

h3. Actual Results
The build fails with the following error: !2193299223-Screen%20Shot%202017-06-29%20at%2015.43.26.png|thumbnail!

"The 'environment' section in your bitbucket-pipelines.yml file must be a map."

h3. Notes
The build succeeds if the example .yml file above includes only

{code}
#!python

MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: password
{code}

in the environment section.
fields.summary: Pipelines fail when the 'environment' section of a service includes more than one values
Pipeline not working on my user! Module Not Found

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://bitbucket-pipelines.atlassian.io/validator
# Try to validate the following:

{code}
#!python

pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
      - step:
          image: redis
          script:
            - redis-cli -h localhost ping
          services:
            - database
definitions:
  services:
    database:
      image: mysql
      environment:
        MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: password

{code}

h3. Expected Results
The file is marked as valid

h3. Actual Results
The following error shows: !142001965-Screen%20Shot%202017-06-29%20at%2013.46.56.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The Pipelines .yml file validator returns an error when defining a service

fields.description:
Currently pipelines are run on branches, which is great however.\\
It would be nice to have a feature where on a non-conflicting change the merged output could be tested and verified, something like:\\
Use-case:\\
I have a branch and someone merges into master -> I want to know the state of what the result of my merge would be. So would the project maintainer.

{code}

pipelines:
  pull-request:
    'master':   
     - step:
         script:
         - tox -e unittest

{code}

then on opening or update of a pull request the pipeline would be triggered if the target branch matches the master.
fields.summary: add pipeline syntax for running build on pull request.

fields.description:
When I try to change the access level of a private repo to public by unchecking the access level box and clicking the "Save repository details", the access level remains private.

Additionally, under Forking dropbox, I only get two options.

!1806389241-repo-access-level-issue.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to change Access level of a repo

fields.description:
The labs page says the following:

bq. Atlassian Editor beta


bq. The new editor provides a new visual refresh and rich content editing experience. This editor is used in comments and pull requests. Look out for the editor coming soon to other Atlassian products near you!


Is my understanding is that Atlassian Editor will become the only option at some point correct? If yes, it will be a significant regression to me and many users, as without an option to edit the underlying Markdown markup it's very difficult to correct mistakes — and for many people, or, in fact, most people knowing Markdown, directly typing the markup is much more productive than playing with buttons and menus of the WYSIWYG editor.

I’m certain removing the Markdown editor will force many users to reconsider their choice of the platform, and even possibly migrate to GitHub (as Mercurial is now a third-class citizen here anyway).
fields.summary: Please keep the Markdown editor

fields.description:
The 'Users on plan' page in an account's or team's Settings shows only the full name of the users in this account/team.

Admins would like to be able to see the Bitbucket username of each account as well.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to see the usernames of my team members in 'Users on plan' page

fields.description:
When making a request to the src api [1] if the request is done without the format=meta flag the request works even if the branch or file specified in the request do not exist. A relevant error message is returned with a 404 status code.

When the same request is performed but with the format=meta flag set the response code is 500 and an html page is returned.

Relevant 500 response code from the html file: 80ea664a55844456a9366acf7ce19449

[1] https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/src#get
fields.summary: Bitbucket src API not working with format=meta when the file or branch specified in the request do not exist

fields.description: Can be please added PHP highlighting in markdown?
fields.summary: Markdown PHP support

fields.description:
Might be worth adding one extra\\
line on terminal (since a bunch are being added already) to just explain that it's for\\
Pride or whatever holiday?
fields.summary: Add a description to holidays easter eggs on terminal - Customer

fields.description: Hi, I'd like to be able to receive a webhook when someone create a new tasks or check an existing one.
fields.summary: Add webhook event for tasks creation/checking

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Admins who enforce 2FA for their team, may sometimes want to exclude certain accounts from that requirement.\\
An example scenario: a certain username is used by their CI server, and there is a bug in the CI system with accounts that have 2FA enabled:

* https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-45129

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow team admins to exclude accounts from the 2FA requirement on the team.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to exclude bot users from 2FA requirement

fields.description:
Hey,

For your pre-defined {{composer}} cache, you cache the {{vendor}} directory.\\
You should in fact cache {{$HOME/.composer/cache}} for greater coverage.

Thanks
fields.summary: Pipelines caches: pre-defined `composer` caches wrong directory

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:

* Go login and choose Google login.
* Sign in to Google Account with no bitbucket account associated.
* Click login.
* Click log in with Google.

Now we cannot choose the real account to log in with, since Google oauth step is arelady done with the previous falsely chosen account.\\
Also we have no trivial way to clear session from GUI. (We can clear from dev tools, etc though.)

I hope there to be some sort of 'try with another social account button' in the page attached as a screenshot.
fields.summary: No trivial way to clear session when flasely started Google login with a wrong account
docker container run options

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when a Free account/team with no credit card on file uses all their Pipelines minutes, the builds stop running.

Sometimes it's not clear to the account/team owners why builds no longer run.

h3. Suggested Solution
Account/team owners of Free accounts would like to receive a notification (e.g. email, or UI notification) when they hit the limit, with instructions on how to buy more Pipelines minutes.
fields.summary: As an admin of a Free account/team I want to be notified when Pipelines build limits are met

fields.description:
If the Docker image you use as a build environment in Bitbucket Pipelines is not root, the SSH key can not be used in connections.

As a workaround you can manually pass in an SSH key and configure it as part of your build: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/How-do-I-set-up-ssh-public-key-authentication-so-that-I-can-use/qaq-p/171671
fields.summary: Pipelines SSH Keys only work for root users

fields.description:
In "Edit branch permissions" (see attached "bitbucket checks required.png") I'd like one more tick box under merge checks. The merge check would be something like "Sync not required".

When enabled merging would be prevented if "sync now" message appears in the source branch's commits list (see attached "sync now.png").

Currently merging is only prevented if there is a merge conflict. I'd like it to be prevented if any all cases.

Github has recently introduced this feature and I'm hoping Bitbucket will too.
fields.summary: Add merge check for sync now

fields.description:
RE: https://twitter.com/hemp/status/878347845757161472

I currently use the bitbucket public-api to turn on PR merge criteria and to add branch restrictions to all my teams repositories with an OAuth consumer.  Simple things like master cannot be directly written to in order to force PRs.

We like the new feature of "Require issue keys in commit messages" and would like to be able to turn this on via an API for code change traceability.  Right now it looks like we would have to manually edit each repo with the UI to do this.

Thanks!
fields.summary: API for turning on "Require issue keys in commit messages"

fields.description:
Git Large File Storage (LFS) replaces large files such as audio samples, videos, datasets, and graphics with text pointers inside Git, while storing the file contents on a remote server.

With Git LFS 2.0.0 you can now lock files that you're actively working on, preventing others from pushing to the Git LFS server until you unlock the files again.

This will prevent merge conflicts as well as lost work on non-mergeable files at the filesystem level. While it may seem to contradict the distributed and parallel nature of Git, file locking is an important part of many software development workflows particularly for larger teams working with binary assets.

https://github.com/blog/2328-git-lfs-2-0-0-released\\
https://github.com/git-lfs/git-lfs/wiki/File-Locking

What I'm thinking is not only a visual representation on your website GUI but also some front-end functionality on SourceTree such as the currently implemented SourceTree Git LFS warning that XYZ file(S) are larger than 2MB.

I'd look to GitLab's iteration for guidance: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/file_lock.html
fields.summary: Git LFS (v2.x) File Locking Support

fields.description:
We have started using bitbucket pipeline since two weeks ago. The main issue we currently have with pipeline is that sometimes the agents that take the job are too slow!

For example, sometimes, a simple docker image building task would take 30 minutes!! However, if I stop it and re-run it again, it could be completed in less than 5 minutes.

I have read the pipeline limitation document but it does not mention anything about the CPU limitation. I think it would be a good idea to explain these kind of limitations in the [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/limitations-of-bitbucket-pipelines-827106051.html](limitation document) as well.

We need to have an environment to be consistent from run to run. I'm not sure if other users have experience like us or not.
fields.summary: Pipeline agents sometimes are too slow

fields.description:
We've got one git repository for a big multi-module project. Many users commit to different parts of this repository, but our team only develops couple of modules.

We would like to have information when certain user(members of our team) creates a pull request in this repository. Information should be a message posted to dedicated slack channel. With Slack for Bitbucket app We can connect BitBucket repository to Slack, but this is only for all pull requests created in this repository.
fields.summary: Webhook on specified user on pull request

fields.description:
When I merge a PR the date reported by the PR and the actually commit are different (by hours). For example here is the commit view:

!2029819783-commit_date.png|thumbnail!

There is the activity view on the same PR:

!905667746-activity.png|thumbnail!

The first one is the correct time. The second time seems to be the UTC of first.
fields.summary: Dates are incorrectly displayed in the PR activity view

pre-receive hook declined

I'm the admin, and never had any issues committing before

fields.description:
Python3 now allows non-ascii characters to be used as identifiers. The current Python highlighting for Python2. This leads to the highlighting showing invalid errors:

!2862249470-python3.png|thumbnail!

Either the detection of the difference between Python2 or Python3 should be better or we should let the user chose Python3 from the UI.
fields.summary: Valid Python3 non-ascii identifiers being highlighted as errors in source view

fields.description: I'm trying to create a running webserver using bitbucket pipeline where I can run a simulation test. e.g. functional/api test. After configuring the requirements and all, then running the httpd, pipeline already end the execution. I'm hoping that the multi steps can help me but it's not yet supported so is there any workaround for this where I can run the httpd without stopping the scripts?
fields.summary: Pipeline stops after running httpd

fields.description:
We should hange the description to something a little less misleading, but I don't know what would be the best description here.

Now I can imagine a situation when there are 3 builds for each commit, and when you choose that, you need at least one successful build on the last commit from the dropdown it means that you need 3 to pass. It should be more like:

I need one successful build from each build system on the last commit.
fields.summary: Change the merge check warning for unsuccessful builds

fields.description:
After upgrading to Atlassian Bitbucket v5.1.0 application links stopped working.

If deleted and a new one is added, the operation times out, and the error log says the manifest is not found. However, the path included in the log is missing the context path prefix.

All other functionality works as expected, other than the application links.

A manual curl request suceeds (https://frottage/bitbucket/rest/applinks/1.0/manifest)

*base URL*\\
https://frottage/bitbucket

*bitbucket.properties*\\
server.port=7990\\
server.secure=true\\
server.scheme=https\\
server.proxy-name=frottage\\
server.proxy-port=443\\
server.context-path=/bitbucket

*error log*\\
2017-06-22 19:48:38,363 ERROR [http-nio-7990-exec-7] bob @13C46N1x17187x423x1 x5rkk6 172.28.0.174,127.0.0.1 "GET /rest/applinks/3.0/applicationlink\\
Form/manifest.json HTTP/1.0" c.a.a.c.r.u.CreateApplicationLinkUIResource Null manifest retrieved
fields.summary: Add Application Link not using context path

fields.description:
it would be great, if we can clear caches directly from commit.. with a command like we use to skip deploys [skip ci]

this is because sometimes i forget to clear the cache when adding new dependencies.. and build fails bc of missing dependencies
fields.summary: Add [clear caches] commit command to pipelines alpha

fields.description:
Since we use public available images from sources like Docker Hub we could not guarantee that someone modifies the image. Worst case an attacker could change the image to put a trojan in our binaries.

So, how to prevent this?

I think that it will be a very good idea to add a checksum verification to Pipelines. This way, we could test and analyze the image. Combined with the checksum we could guarantee that the tested and analyzed image is used for builds.
fields.summary: Allow docker image to be pulled by digest hash
Local links within markdown files in the repository don't work

fields.description: I've noticed 'recent activity' rss feed is no longer available on dashboard/team page. The list is present but rss feed has been removed. I use to be able to retrieve activity list through basic curl execution, however since rss feed is no longer present, it stopped working. I'm curious to find out if there is alternative to pull 'recent activity' list.
fields.summary: Recent Activity RSS feed removed?

fields.description:
Sometimes a part of the diff will load, followed by blank space (and a checkered gray/white background in the middle). If you scroll down past the section that didn't load and then back up it will usually finish loading. However, if the section which fails to load is at the bottom of the file (the case I ran into today which moved the issue from minor to one where I have to use a different diff tool), this trick won't work and it's not possible to see the side-by-side diff for that portion of the file, even after refreshing the page.

First seen: it's been this way for well over a year

Frequency: happens regularly; when viewing files and it happens, it always happens for that file

Environment: Windows 10 / Chrome 58

Under OSX, the same behavior happens when zooming below 100%
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff: Checkerboard showing when trying to view side-by-side diff in Chrome

fields.description:
I'm a developer / user in a team and I don't have any administrative rights in Bitbucket. Basically I'm only able to devliver code (commits).

_Can you add some kind of a counter / an overview where I (as a user or development team member) can see how many build minutes the account has left resp. how many minutes Pipelines war running so far so that I can ask the admin to buy more build minutes BEFORE Pipelines stops working?_
fields.summary: Build minutes counter

Hello Team!

Today we have a problem to see diff on Pull Request page online for our project.

The top part with list of changed files and general comments works fine.

--\\
Thank you,\\
Sergiy Zinovyev

fields.description:
There's no way to edit branch permission to configure it to prevent branch deletion in the new UI; a user will need to be added into Write Access first, and then the checkbox will appear.

Workaround for this issue:

* Edit Branch Permission
* Add any user to "Write Access". (It should show the two options - Allow rewriting history and deleting branch)
* Uncheck the option
* Click Save
* It should resolve the issue.
fields.summary: In Branch Permission - "Allow deleting this branch" checkbox only appears once a user is added into Write Access, or else it wouldn't appear.

fields.description:
Hi.

I know there are emails set up for when pipelines fail, but I'd also like to be able to receive emails when pipeline builds pass (primarily for the first build on a pull request, or the first passing build on a branch after a failure).

At the moment it's a pain always having to go back and keep checking the pipeline to find out when I can open/merge pull requests.

Thanks.
fields.summary: First Success Pipeline for branch email notification

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a repository with a master branch and a feature branch
# In Bamboo, create a plan connected to this repository
# In Bamboo plan branch configuration, enable Branch Updater automatic merging with push on success enabled
# Create a branch plan for feature branch
# Make a commit to master
# Make a commit to feature (non conflicting change)
# Run the branch plan

h3. Observation
Bamboo add a new commit to feature branch in Bitbucket Cloud. However this commit is never built as it was built before the push by Bamboo. Bamboo also ignores this commit when polling for changes.

This will cause merge checks with success builds to fail as the latest commit does not have a build. The only workaround would be to run the branch plan again manually so that the latest commit gets built.
fields.summary: Merge check does not work when using Branch Updater automatic branch merging on Bamboo

fields.description: It would be extremely useful to have a tool to report the number of commits, on a defined time space, each member of the team have made based on the account.
fields.summary: Team activity report.

fields.description:
I would like to get weekly summary of my activity to email.\\
Most important part would be my commits through last week in different projects.\\
Nice to have would be summary how many files I have changes, how many lines commited, etc.

It takes me 10min a week to select my commits and it would improve my life
fields.summary: Mail weekly update about user's activity

fields.description:
Hi,

Its not possible to invite user directly to group (ex. developers) via API\\
as it is possible via Bitbucket web through:

Settings -> Access management -> User Groups -> Add member

To invite user to group via API its needed to do it in two steps:

# Invite user to repo
# assign user to group (can bo done only after user confirms/accepts invitation)

Could you please add this enhancement , so that we can invite users to specific group (so that user receives invitation to the bitbucket , and when confirmed , gets assigned to desired group)
fields.summary: Not possible to invite new user directly to group through API

Please see Screen shots  attached that demonstrate this issue and shows a comparison between the old interface and the new
fields.summary: In the new Bitbucket interface, when creating a pull request the suggested reviewers are covered by the field
